content.description: P1 (5.6): Follow right corner to 4th class ramp to a belay ledge on the left side of the arete.   P2 (5.8+): Climb the arete under a roof.  Go right beneath roof around the corner.  Follow the obvious vertical crack, very exposed.   P3 (5.5): Work up face to the arete.  Pass stump with rappel anchor and continue to trees.
content.location: Rappel from stump with anchor.  Possible 70m rappel with a tag line.

content.description: No trails lead to these cliffs.  Very secluded, and it appears that the last period of popular climbing here was in the early 1990s.  Lots of rock fall in the surrounding area around the cliffs, some looking recent.  Loose rock on climbs also.  Test any blocks or flakes for the hollow/loose sound/feel before pulling or placing protection.  There is a fair amount of lichen, but nothing out of the ordinary for the Lake George area.
